honeywell.printer

Class DocumentLP

  • java.lang.Object
    • honeywell.printer.Document
      • honeywell.printer.DocumentLP

  • public class DocumentLP
extends Document
    This class handles the interface between the printer and the user application that wishes to use an Datamax-O'Neil printer. These functions can be used to 'build' a document using abstract methods instead of the raw 'LP Print' mode commands. A simple example is:

        // Print Hello World
    DocumentLP docLP;
    docLP = new DocumentLP("$");
    docLP.writeText("Hello World");
    This document can then be sent to a PrinterONeil object through the print method to print out.

      Different character sets you can use to remap a font

    • Constructor Detail

      • DocumentLP

        public DocumentLP(java.lang.String fontName)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor will create a blank Document object and set the default font to use to the one specified.
        Parameters:
        fontName - The one character font name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • getPageLength

        public int getPageLength()
        This is the number of text lines per 'page'. This value is used when the advanceToNextPage() function is called. The total height is based on the currently selected font.
        Returns:
        The number of text lines per page. The default page size is 0 which means to use the printer setting.

      • setPageLength

        public void setPageLength(int textLines)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This is the number of text lines per 'page'. This value is used when the advanceToNextPage() function is called. The total height is based on the currently selected font.
        Parameters:
        textLines - The number of text lines per page. The default page size is 0 which means to use the printer setting. Valid values are from 0 to 255.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

      • getLineSpacing

        public int getLineSpacing()
        This is the number of dotlines to add in between each text line.
        Returns:
        The number of 1/8mm dotlines to put between each text line. The default value is 0.

      • setLineSpacing

        public void setLineSpacing(int dotLines)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This is the number of dotlines to add in between each text line.
        Parameters:
        dotLines - The number of 1/8mm dotlines to put between each text line. The default value is 0 and the range of values is 0 to 255.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

      • getCharacterRemap

        public DocumentLP.CharacterSet getCharacterRemap()
        This will cause some of the international characters, when using a CP437 224 character font, to be remapped. The default value for this is CharacterSet.USA.
        Returns:
        The mapping of which CP437 224 character fonts to use.

      • setCharacterRemap

        public void setCharacterRemap(DocumentLP.CharacterSet characterSet)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This will cause some of the international characters, when using a CP437 224 character font, to be remapped. The default value for this is CharacterSet.USA.
        Parameters:
        characterSet - The mapping of which CP437 224 character fonts to use.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

      • writeText

        public void writeText(java.lang.String textString)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        This function will print the provided text, appending a line feed/carrage return, to the document object using the default printing parameter values.
        Parameters:
        textString - This is the text you wish to print.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

      • writeText

        public void writeText(java.lang.String textString,
                      ParametersLP parameters)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        This function will print the provided text, appending a line feed/carriage return, to the document object using the provided printing parameter values.
        Parameters:
        textString - This is the text you wish to print.
        parameters - This ParametersLP object specifies any printing parameter values you wish to alter for the printing of this item.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.

      • writeImage

        public void writeImage(android.graphics.Bitmap imageObject,
                       int printHeadWidth)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This will cause the image specified to be printed. Images will be expanded to occupy the entire width of the printer, so the correct current width of the printer must be specified. Images that are too wide will be cropped, and images that are too narrow will be padded on the right.
        Parameters:
        imageObject - Image to print
        printHeadWidth - Width of the print head in dots. Usually 384 for 2 inch printers, 576 for 3 inch and 832 for 4 inch.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • writeImage

        public void writeImage(android.graphics.Bitmap imageObject,
                       int printHeadWidth,
                       int darknessThreshold)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This will cause the image specified to be printed. Images will be expanded to occupy the entire width of the printer, so the correct current width of the printer must be specified. Images that are too wide will be cropped, and images that are too narrow will be padded on the right.
        Parameters:
        imageObject - Image to print
        printHeadWidth - Width of the print head in dots. Usually 384 for 2 inch printers, 576 for 3 inch and 832 for 4 inch.
        darknessThreshold - Threshold to adjust darkness of the image. Valid values are 0 - 255.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameter values are not in the valid range this exception is thrown.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • writePDF

        public void writePDF(java.lang.String filePath,
                     int printHeadWidth)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        This prints the PDF file specified by the user.
        Parameters:
        filePath - file path of the PDF file to be printed
        printHeadWidth - Printhead width of printer (eg. 384 for 2 in., 576 for 3 in., 832 for 4 in.)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there are any errors

      • advanceToNextPage

        public void advanceToNextPage()
        This command will causes a form feed to occur from the papers current location. The size of a form can be set with the setPageLength() function.

      • advanceToQueueMark

        public void advanceToQueueMark(int additionalRows)
        This will advance the paper to the next queue mark and an additional number of dotlines as specified by the input parameter.
        Parameters:
        additionalRows - Number of dotlines to move beyond the queue mark. Each dotline is 1/8mm high and valid values are between 0 and 65535.

      • getDocumentData

        public byte[] getDocumentData()
        This method will return the rendered document in the printer's language for sending directly to the printer.
        Specified by:
        getDocumentData in class Document
        Returns:
        Rendered document in the printer's language.
        Since:
        1.1.0
